member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.TunerBrowseContextBase.ScrollSelect
member.summary: Selects the corresponding item on the current page. Valid values are 1 - 20.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.TunerBrowseContextBase.ChannelNumberFeedback
member.summary: The channel (station) number of each item in the scrolling list, relative to its position on the current page. There are twenty channel number feedbacks numbered 1 - 20.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.TunerBrowseContextBase.IndexFeedback
member.summary: The index number of each item in the scrolling list, relative to its position on the current page. There are twenty index number feedbacks numbered 1 - 20.

member.summary: The channel number of each item in the scrolling list, relative to its position on the current page. There are twenty channel number feedbacks numbered 1 - 20.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.TunerBrowseContextBase.IndexAsStringFeedback
member.summary: Reports the index number of each item in a scrolling list, relative to its position on the current page. There are twenty index number feedbacks numbered 1 - 20.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBrowseContext.StationFeedback
member.summary: The currently selected station, e.g., "95.5".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBrowseContext.FMRDSNameFeedback
member.summary: When the FM band is active (BandFMFeedback = true) and reporting is enabled on the FMRDS card, this serial reports the program service name of the current station. Typically these are the call letters of the station, e.g., WBGO.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBrowseContext.FMRDSMessageFeedback
member.summary: When the FM band is active (BandFMFeedback = true) and reporting is enabled on the FMRDS card, this serial reports the radio text for the current station. This can include information such as phone numbers, artist names, song titles or station names. The string size is 32 characters for the Version B RDS/RBDS protocol; and 64 characters for the Version A RDS/RBDS protocol. Thus the user interface should be able to display 64 characters for this text field.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBrowseContext.FMRDSGenreFeedback
member.summary: When the FM band is active (BandFMFeedback = true) and reporting is enabled on the FMRDS card, this serial reports the program type name of the current station, with additional information about a given category.

member.summary: Jumps to the corresponding position in the browse list.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseBrowseContext.PktDelta
member.summary: If an APAD is being used to access the music collection, this input should be driven by the PktDelta output of the APAD Knob symbol, to allow the APAD to scroll through the lists.
member.remarks: The integer value from the APAD is the number of clicks that the navigation knob has turned in the clockwise or counter-clockwise direction, and ranges from -32767 to +32767.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseBrowseContext.PktTime
member.summary: If an APAD is being used to access the music collection, this input should be driven by the PktTime output of the APAD Knob symbol, to allow the APAD to scroll through the lists.
member.remarks: The integer value from the APAD is the time, in hundredths of a second (1 = 0.01s), that has elapsed since the last time the knob was turned.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseBrowseContext.NumberOfLines
member.summary: Sets the number of lines that will make up a pages. Defaults to 10 if not set on the FIRST browse context only. All additional browse context must define the number of lines.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 1 to 10. If the values changes, this may cause the device to jump to the main menu. The input must be defined on additional browse contexts; otherwise, the browse context will not work.

member.summary: Increments the last character in the SearchTextFeedback output string.
member.remarks: If the last character is the letter B, calling this method will cause the cursor to scroll up to the next letter (C, then D, then E, etc.).

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenIdocIserverSearch.ScrollDecrement
member.summary: Decrements the last character in the SearchTextFeedback output string.
member.remarks: if the last character is the number 8, calling this method will cause the cursor to scroll down to the previous digit (7, then 6, then 5, etc.).

member.summary: Moves the cursor to the right with each call.

member.summary: Tunes to the next station frequency on a pulse. If the input remains set to true for longer than 300 milliseconds, the tuner will auto repeat until the input is set to false or after 500 repeats.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SatelliteBase.StatusFeedback
member.summary: The lower 10 bits of the analog value indicate diagnostic information reported by the tuner module. Note that the bit fields have no additional processing. They report exactly what the tuner module reports. Composite signal strength Bit 0: 1 = No signal Bit 1: 1 = Weak signal Bit 2: 1 = Moderate signal Bit 3: 1 = Strong signal Error messages Bit 4: 1 = No Antenna: This bit reports the status of antenna detection only and does not depend on the audio status. In contrast, the "Antenna Disconnected" advisory message on the ActiveChannelNameFeedback is only displayed when the antenna is disconnected AND there is a corresponding loss of audio. Bit 5: 1 = Audio NOT OK (also reported on the ActChanName output) Bit 6: 1 = Health NOT OK Bit 7: 1 = GCI changing (also reported on the ActChanName output) Bit 8: 1 = NOT primary module Bit 9: 1 = Data services changing Bit 10 through Bit 15: Unused

member.summary: Moves the position within the current track backward.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.DisableAllFeedbacks
member.summary:
Disables , , , , , , , , and for as long as the input is 'true'.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.DisablePlayProgress
member.summary:
Disables the PlayProgressFeedback for as long as the input is 'true'. This mode is useful to reduce Ethernet traffic when the remaining seconds information is not needed.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.DisableElapsedSeconds
member.summary:
Disables the ElapsedSecondsFeedback for as long as the input is 'true'. This mode is useful to reduce Ethernet traffic when the remaining seconds information is not needed.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.DisableRemainingSeconds
member.summary:
Disables the RemainingSecondsFeedback for as long as the input is 'true'. This mode is useful to reduce Ethernet traffic when the remaining seconds information is not needed.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.AudioPlaylistName
member.summary: The name of the current audio playlist.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.PlayMatching
member.summary: Plays back all tracks that match the specified criteria. Syntax: {{TITLE:'Title'}} {{ARTIST:'Artist'}} {{ALBUM:'Name'}} {{GENRE:'Genre'}} {{YEAR:'Year'}} {{COMPOSER:'Composer'}}

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.CRPC
member.summary: Intended for use ONLY with the Smart Graphics Media Player Extender.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.PlayFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that playback is in progress. The output remains 'true' for as long as a track is playing.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.PauseFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that playback has been paused. The output remains 'true' for as long as playback is paused.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.StopFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that playback has been stopped. The output remains 'true' for as long as playback is stopped.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.RewindFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the current track is rewinding. The output remains 'true' for as long as the rewind is active.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.FastForwardFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the current track is fast-forwarding. The output remains 'true' for as long as the fast forward is active.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.ShuffleOffFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that "Shuffle" mode is turned off. The output remains 'true' for as long as shuffle mode is off.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.ShuffleAlbumFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that "Shuffle Album" mode is on. The output remains 'true' for as long as the mode is on.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.ShuffleTrackFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that "Shuffle Track" mode is on. The output remains 'true' for as long as the mode is on.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.RepeatOffFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that "Repeat Track" mode is inactive. The output remains 'true' for as long as repeat track mode is off.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.RepeatTrackFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that "Repeat Track" mode is active. The output remains 'true' for as long as repeat track mode is on.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.RepeatAllFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that "Repeat All" mode is active. The output remains 'true' for as long as repeat all mode is on.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.DisableAllFeedbacksFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the indicator outputs are currently disabled. The output remains 'true' for as long as the outputs are disabled.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.DisableElapsedSecondsFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that elapsed seconds reporting is disabled. The output remains 'true' for as long as reporting is disabled.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.DisablePlayProgressFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that play progress reporting is disabled. The output remains 'true' for as long as reporting is disabled.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.DisableRemainingSecondsFeedback
member.summary:

The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.BaseTransportControls.BusyFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the device is busy and cannot accept commands. The output remains high for as long as the device is busy.
The event will trigger with .
The event will trigger with .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.LockCurrentChannel
member.summary: Turns on parental lockout for the currently tuned channel.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.UnlockCurrentChannel
member.summary: Unlocks the currently tuned channel.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.RestoreDefaultPin
member.summary: Restores the default PIN (1234d) for tuning to locked channels.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.TunerChange
member.summary: When a tuner feedback has changed this event will fire. EventIds for this event are located in the class.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.SourceName
member.summary: Source name string that will be displayed on the CEN-TRACK front panel, which identifies the corresponding tuner source.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.SourceNameFeedback
member.summary: The currently defined source name string.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.Number
member.summary: The number of this source on the Cen-Track.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.DSTOn
member.summary: Enables adjustment for Daylight Savings Time.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.DisplayLongChannelNames
member.summary: Enables the display of long channel names.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.DisplayLongCategoryNames
member.summary: Enables the display of long category names (maximum 16 characters) on the ActiveChannelCategoryFeedback output.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.ReportLockedInGuide
member.summary: Enables channels in the guide list to be reported on the GuideInfoFeedback serial output even if the channel attribute is set to locked.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.ProtectedChannelRequest
member.summary: Tunes to the specified channel (whether skipped, locked or un-subscribed) and screens for a valid PIN if the channel has the parental lockout attribute set. Valid values range from 0d to 223d. Channels outside of this range will be ignored. 0d corresponding to Station 0, which displays the ID number of the tuner module which will be required to activate the Satellite Radio service.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.SetPIN
member.summary: Sets the PIN required to tune to locked channels. This signifies that the PIN specified by PINEntry must match SetPIN. Valid values range from 1d to 65536d. A value of 0d is ignored. The default PIN number is 1234d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.PINEntry
member.summary: The PIN entered by the user to unlock and tune to the current (locked) channel. This value will be parsed by the device and must match SetPIN.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.UnprotectedChannelRequest
member.summary: Tunes to the specified station number (whether skipped, locked or un-subscribed) but DOES NOT block access if the channel is locked. Valid analog values range from 0d to 223d. Channels outside of this range will be ignored.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.UpdatingGuideFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the GuideInfoFeedback is being updated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.SignalStrengthEnableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that signal strength reporting is enabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.SignalStrengthDisableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that signal strength reporting is disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.CurrentChannelLockedFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the currently tuned channel is locked.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.PinRequiredFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the currently requested channel requires a PIN number to be entered in order to tune to that station.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.PinInUseFeedback
member.summary: Reports the current PIN that the tuner is using for tuning to locked channels.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Sirius.ActiveChannelComposerFeedback
member.summary: The composer of the current track, if available.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Am
member.summary: AM source.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase
member.summary: Base for AM and FM sources.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase._BandSelect
member.summary: Sets the tuner to the AM or FM band depending on the class that it is set from.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase._ScanPlus
member.summary: Scans up to the next available (valid) station, pauses for 5 seconds, and then continues scanning to the next station. Stops scan when set to true during a scan or when it wraps around to the original station.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase._ScanMinus
member.summary: Scans down to the next available (valid) station, pauses for 5 seconds, and then continues scanning to the next station. Stops scan when set to true during a scan or when it wraps around to the original station.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase._SearchPlus
member.summary: Searches for the next available (valid) station in the up direction. The tuner then tunes to that station.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase._SearchMinus
member.summary: Searches for the next available (valid) station in the down direction. The tuner then tunes to that station.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.#ctor(Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.eSourceType)
member.summary: Constructs an AmFmBase object.
member.param: The type of source that is being created.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.BandSelect
member.summary: Sets the tuner to the band.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.ScanPlus
member.summary: Toggles scan forward.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.ScanMinus
member.summary: Toggles scan backward.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.SearchPlus
member.summary: Searches forward for the next available (valid) FM station.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.SearchMinus
member.summary: Searches backward for the next available (valid) FM station.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.Frequency
member.summary: Sets the tuner to the indicated FM frequency. In US mode, valid analog values range from 8800d (for 88.00MHz) to 10800d (for 108.00MHz). The values increment in 10d steps. In European mode, valid analog values range from 8750d (for 87.50MHz) to 10800d (for 108.00MHz). The values increment in 5d steps.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.BandSelectFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that this band is currently selected.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.ScanningFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the tuner is currently scanning (via scan +/-) or searching (via search+/-) for FM stations.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.SigStrengthEnableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that FM signal strength reporting is currently enabled. This output does not apply to the CEN-TRACK-AMFMXM Rev2, which does not support signal strength reporting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.AmFmBase.SigStrengthDisableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that FM signal strength reporting is currently disabled. This output does not apply to the CEN-TRACK-AMFMXM Rev2, which does not support signal strength reporting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspBase.SourceSelect
member.summary:
Property to select the input source.
This property is set by making it equal to an available input source.
Example: "myHDXSP.SourceSelect = myHDXSP.InputSource[3];" or "myHDXSP.SourceSelect = myHDXSP.OpticalInputs[1]".
"myHDXSP.SourceSelect = null;" Will select no input.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspBase.SourceSelectFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the current input source.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.PINSubpage(System.UInt32)
member.summary: When the PIN subpage is active these inputs add the corresponding digit to the PIN buffer. The resulting PIN is compared to CurrentPINFeedback to determine if the user will be given access to a locked channel. If the New PIN subpage is active these inputs add the corresponding digit to the PIN buffer to create the new PIN. Valid values are 0 - 9.
member.param: Specified subpage

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.LockedChannelsFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the corresponding channel is locked.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.Composer
member.summary: The string of information about the composer.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.ShowNewPINSubpageFeedback
member.summary: When the Tech page is active, this output indicates that the TechSelectNewPIN input has been triggered. When connected properly to the associated subpage in the VTPro-e project, this will activate the Enter PIN subpage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.ShowPINSubpageFeedback
member.summary: When the Tech page is active, this output indicates that the TechSelectSetupChannels or the TechSelectNewPIN input has been triggered. When connected properly to the associated subpage in the VTPro-e project, this will activate the Enter PIN subpage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.IncorrectPINMessageFeedback
member.summary: When the Enter PIN subpage is active, this output indicates that the tuner is currently saving a new PIN. When connected properly to the associated subpage or popup window in the VTPro-e project, this will activate the Storing New PIN message.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.StoringNewPINMessageFeedback
member.summary: When the Enter PIN subpage is active, this output indicates that the tuner is currently saving a new PIN. When connected properly to the associated subpage or popup window in the VTPro-e project, this will activate the Storing New PIN message.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.TunerChannelLockedFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the current channel is locked.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.CurrentPINFeedback
member.summary: The current PIN, which will be compared to the user entry to determine if the user will be allowed access to a locked channel. The default PIN is 1234d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.NewPINFeedback
member.summary: The new PIN that will overwrite the current PIN, on the next PINSubpageEnter.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.PINSubpageDisplayFeedback
member.summary: String of asterisks, representing each digit being entered on the PIN keypad.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.SiriusBrowseContext.TunedComposerFeedback
member.summary: The corresponding string of information about the currently playing song.

member.summary: The lower six bits of the integer value report the capabilities of the current active player as follows: bit 0 = Pause supported bit 1 = Fast Forward supported bit 2 = Rewind supported bit 3 = Skip Next supported bit 4 = Skip Previous supported bit 5 = Thumbs Up / Thumbs Down supported bit 6 = Bookmarks supported All players must support Play / Stop.

member.summary: Indicates that the FM tuner is in the mono state.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.StereoFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the FM audio is in stereo mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.PTYDisable
member.summary: Disables ProgramTypeCode and ProgramTypeName while set to true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.PSNameDisable
member.summary: Disables ProgramServiceName while set to true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.ClockDisable
member.summary: Disables all universal time clock (UTC) signals while set to true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.RadioTextDisable
member.summary: Disables RadioText while set to true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.TA_TP_RDS_Disable
member.summary: Disables TAStateReport, TPStateReport and RBDSStation while set to true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.TuneByTraffic
member.summary: Selects a traffic report station to search. Setting this property to a valid value initiates the search. The search stops when a corresponding traffic station is found or the starting station is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.RBDSProgramTypeCodeUS
member.summary: Returns the program type code. This value is only valid if the tuner is in US mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.RDSProgramTypeCodeEurope
member.summary: Returns the program type code. This value is only valid if the tuner is in European mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.TAStateReport
member.summary: Reports whether the current station broadcasts special traffic announcements.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.TPStateReport
member.summary: Reports whether the current station regularly broadcasts traffic information throughout the day.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.StationCommunicationProtocolFeedback
member.summary: Reports whether the current station supports RDS/RBDS.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.UTCMinute
member.summary: The UTC (Universal Time Clock) minute reading. The value will range from 0d to 59d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.UTCHour
member.summary: The UTC hour of the day. The value will range from 0d, for 12:00 A.M. (midnight) to 23d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.UTCDay
member.summary: The UTC (Universal Time Clock) day of the month. The value will range from 1d to 31d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.UTCMonth
member.summary: The UTC (Universal Time Clock) month of the year. The value will range from 1d (for January) to 12d (for December).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.UTCYear
member.summary: The UTC (Universal Time Clock) year. For example, the year 2004 will report as 2004d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.OffsetFromUTC
member.summary: The UTC (Universal Time Clock) offset from GMT.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.ProgramServiceName
member.summary: The program service name of the current station. Typically these are the call letters of the station, e.g., WBGO.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.RadioText
member.summary: The radio text for the current station. This can include information such as phone numbers, artist names, song titles or station names.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Fm.ProgramTypeName
member.summary: The program type name of the current station. This string contains additional information about a given category.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenTrack.FrontPanelLock
member.summary: Locks out the front panel pushbuttons.

member.summary: Unlocks the front panel pushbuttons.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenTrack.SystemInitializedFeedback
member.summary: Returns value that indicates system initialization status.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenTrack.AmFm_US_Europe
member.summary: Sets the AM and FM frequency step rate to European mode when the input is true. When the input is false the step rate is set to US mode. For AM, the US step rate is 10kHz; the European step rate is 9kHz. For FM, the US step rate is 100kHz; the European step rate is 50kHz.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenTrack.GMTOffset
member.summary: Specifies the number of minutes to offset from GMT the time parameters reported by the tuner. Valid values range from -720d to +720d. The default value of 0d signifies no GMT offset.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenTrack.BacklightIntensity
member.summary: Sets the brightness level of the LCD display. Valid values range from 0% (minimum brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenTrack.LEDBrightness
member.summary: Sets the brightness level of the LEDs over the tuner selection buttons. Valid values range from 0% (minimum brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenTrack.FrontPanelLockFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the front panel buttons are locked.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.CenTrack.AMFM_US_EuropeFeedback
member.summary: Indicates whether the step rate is set to European or US mode. True = European mode. False = US mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Preset.Press
member.summary: Selects the station preset. If pressed for less than the time specified in PresetPressAndHoldTime then the preset is selected. When pressed for the amount of time (or longer) set in PresetPressAndHoldTime then the preset is assigned the string set in Name or deleted if already assigned. If Name is empty a default name is assigned.
member.remarks: When True = No effect, False = Select/store/delete station preset.

member.summary: The name (up to 250 characters) of the preset which will be assigned using the Press. When this property is empty a default name is assigned to it.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.Preset.NameFeedback
member.summary:

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutput.EQ
member.summary:
Sets the Equalization selection for this output.
This is only supported when is .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutput.Bass
member.summary:
Set the bass levels in decibels.
Valid values range from -120 (-12dB) to 120 (12dB) adjustable in increments of 0.1dB (1 = 0.1dB).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutput.Treble
member.summary:
Set the treble levels in decibels.
Valid values range from -120 (-12dB) to 120 (12dB) adjustable in increments of 0.1dB (1 = 0.1dB).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutput.MinimumVolume
member.summary:
Defines the minimum volume (the volume the output will be set to when the HD-XSP powers on) in percent. Valid values are from 0% to 50%.
Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutput.MaximumVolume
member.summary:
Defines the maximum volume (the volume the output will be set to when the HD-XSP powers on) in percent. Valid values are from 70% to 100%.
Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutput.StartupVolume
member.summary:
Defines the startup volume (the volume the output will be set to when the HD-XSP powers on) in percent. Valid values are from 0% to 50%.
Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutput.Balance
member.summary:
Sets the Balance between the left and right channels. Only supported for Downmix outputs.
Valid values range from -50% (Full Left) to +50% (Full Right). A value of 0% (Default) signifies an even balance between the left and right channels

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutput.LoudnessOnFeedback
member.summary:

The event will trigger with .

member.summary: Method to set the trim of the specified output channel.
member.param: Output channel to adjust.

member.remarks: Color depth is counted as the number of bits per color, per pixel, not total bits per (tri-color) pixel. Thus, 8-bit mode is sometimes referred to as "24-bit color"; 10-bit mode, as "30-bit color"; and 12-bit mode, as "36-bit color".

Class that represents a single amplified output channel for the .
This class will trigger the event.

member.summary: Constructor to generate a new HdXspOutputChannelStatus class for an HdXspa.
member.param: Channel this class represents.

member.summary: Return a string representing this HdXspOutputChannelStatus.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutputChannelStatus.DcOffsetFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that a DC fault condition has been detected at the corresponding channel.
A DC fault may indicate an external wiring problem, e.g., speaker wires shorted to a live voltage.
When 'false', this indicates a normal condition.
When the fault condition occurs the output will trigger and the amplifier (all channels) will turn off. The device remains on. The amp will not start again until the fault condition is removed and the Reset button on the front panel is pressed. Pressing the Reset button will only clear the fault if it has been removed.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutputChannelStatus.OverCurrentFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that an Over Current fault condition has been detected at the corresponding channel.
An Over Current fault occurs when the amp is connected to a load that is drawing more than the rated power of the amp.
When 'false', this indicates a normal condition.
When the fault condition occurs the output will trigger and the amplifier (all channels) will turn off. The controller remains on. The amp will not start again until the fault condition is removed and the Reset button on the front panel is pressed. Pressing the Reset button will only clear the fault if it has been removed.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutputChannelStatus.OverOrUnderVoltageFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that an over/under voltage fault condition has been detected at the corresponding channel.
An over/under voltage fault indicates that the power supply voltage level at the corresponding channel is over or under the required level.
When 'false', this indicates a normal condition.
When the fault condition occurs the output will trigger and the amplifier (all channels) will turn off. The controller remains on. The amp will not start again until the fault condition is removed and the Reset button on the front panel is pressed. Pressing the Reset button will only clear the fault if it has been removed.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutputChannelStatus.ClippingFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the signal level at the corresponding channel has begun to clip. This signifies a signal level that is too hot.
The output remains 'true' for as long as the clipping condition exists. When 'false', this indicates a normal condition.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspOutputChannelStatus.Channel
member.summary: Get the channel that this object represents.

member.summary:
Class that represents the available status information of the amplifier on the .
This class will trigger the event.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.EnableTemperatureReporting
member.summary: Enables the to report the internal amplifier temperature.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.DisableTemperatureReporting
member.summary: Disables the from reporting the internal amplifier temperature.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.ToString
member.summary: Return a string representing this HdXspAmplifierStatus.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.AmplifierStatusChange
member.summary:
Event triggered when new amplifier status has been reported to the control system.
Valid event IDs are available in .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.TemperatureHighFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates if the temperature is too high. The temperature is considered too high if device temperature exceeds 85C OR the channel temperature exceeds 95C. When this output is 'true' the amplifier's power turns off. Power is restored when both the device temperature AND channel temperature drop below 75C.
'true' = temperature is high; 'false' = Normal Temperature
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.TemperatureFormat
member.summary:
Sets the format for internal amplifier temperature reporting. When 'false', the format is set to Celsius; when 'true', Fahrenheit.
'true' = Fahrenheit; 'false' = Celsius.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.TemperatureFormatFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the temperature format. The output remains 'true' for as long as the format is set to Fahrenheit. When the output is 'false', this indicates that the format is set to Celsius.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.TemperatureReportingEnabledFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the status of temperature reporting. The output remains 'true' for as long as temperature reporting is enabled; when 'false', this indicates that temperature reporting is disabled.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Media.HdXspAmplifierStatus.TemperatureFeedback
member.summary:
Reports the overall temperature, when temperature reporting is enabled.
If the format is Celsius the reported values will range from 0 to 1250 ( 0°C to 125°C), where 1 = 0.1 degree.
If the format is Fahrenheit the reported values will range from 320 to 2570 (32°F to 257°F), where 1 = 0.1 degree.
The event will trigger with .

member.summary: Collection of amplified output channels for the .

member.summary: Can be assigned anything that user wants.
